Posts.Content: I probably shouldn’t be on this thread as I got my initial diagnosis in March! After first biopsy, I was told I had 2 small lumps grade 1 IDC, spanning 2.5cm overall. I then waited almost 3 weeks for an MRI which came back inconclusive. I then had a full breast ultrasound which highlighted another suspicious area which led to another biopsy, again this came back as grade 1.  This has meant I’m no longer eligible for lumpectomy as its classed as multi focal. I’m booked for mastectomy on the 1st May. I spent the first 4weeks in total shock and yet by the time it came to being told I need an mx, I was strangely calm and unsurprised. I still don’t know what the rest of my treatment plan will be. My biggest problem is that I still haven’t told most of my family. I have no idea how to tell my kids (aged 27 & 9). My mum doesn’t know yet ( we’re not particularly close and I can’t support her when I need my strength for myself) would it be really bad if I did it over the phone? Also does anyone have any advice on how to tell my youngest without scaring her silly. The eldest doesn’t live at home so it’s slightly easier to hide     it from him. Sorry for the essay! I tend to lurk and read everyone’s posts rather than post myself, it seems to have helped me process my thoughts so thank you to everyone on this site.
Posts.Title: April diagnosis group

Posts.Content: I’m not certain but I believe Perjeta is given before surgery to shrink larger tumours. So for me this wouldn’t be given as I’ve already had an mx. They were talking about maybe fec & herceptin but no T. I assume this is because because I’m node negative. The MDT can’t make a clear decision so I’m waiting to see the oncologist. The repeat test on one tumour that came back HER+ seems to be positive by IHC despite the original FISH being negative. The path report is very confused and we have asked for clarification as well as repeat receptor testing on all 3 tumours. Originally they were just ER+
Posts.Title: Refusing chemotherapy after Her2+ results

Posts.Content: Hi Can’t offer advice but I’m in a similar situation. Multifocal IDC, 3 tumours largest of which is 15mm. I had a mastectomy 4weeks ago. Clear nodes stage 1 and very low ki67 scores of 3 & 5%. I was originally told I was HER negative but they have apparently retested and changed one of them to positive! I have requested repeat testing of the HER receptors on all 3. I’ve been told chemo is still not a definite as the data for benefit is mostly based on larger more aggressive tumours. I’m waiting for an appointment with the oncologist to discuss it further. The predict tool may be useful for you. I haven’t checked mine yet, not sure I want to see   the figures in black and white yet!  http://www.predict.nhs.uk/predict_v2.0.html Let me know how you get on and good luck.

Posts.Title: Refusing chemotherapy after Her2+ results

Posts.Content: Hi Kimbeeloo Oncotype dx is not available if you’re her+. You can certainly request repeat testing, I have. I’m still not convinced they’re correct. You can ask how many pathologists have reviewed your result, if only one, then ask for someone else to look at it also. IHC testing tends to be done first as its quicker and cheaper, and if this result is borderline then they will move on to FISH which is more sensitive. I had 3 tumours, all of which were HER negative until they did a repeat test and got one of them positive by IHC even though it was originally negative by FISH! I’ve already had a mastectomy so any further treatment would be to prevent recurrence. I’m seeing an oncologist on Wednesday to discuss it further. Good luck
